14087186.review: I had very low expectations of this release. After playing Sakura Spirit, its predecessor, I was given the impression that Sakura Angels would make a extreme resemblence to Sakura Spirit; with it's lack of choices, pretty linear and boring two-sided story, and not so memorable characters. When I played Sakura Angels however, I was pleasantly surprised. If you are not familiar with the Sakura games they are what many would classify as a 'visual novel'. Of course in a japanese sort-of looking design with lots of Fanservice. Sakura Angels is no doubt 100% better than it's predecessor. It provides you with more choices that you can choose from and they can lead to different types of outcomes (not sure if they effect the ending). Characters in this game seem much more vivid and memorable, and the story was clear and was just straight forward; perfect for this game. It took me three hours to complete Sakura Angels, and nearly an hour and a half for Sakura Spirit. Overall, I think the Sakura franchise still needs a bit of work, but this is an aim in the right direction. I couldn't believe myself asking for more when I finished Sakura Angels, it was a definite improvement from it's previous game by ten-fold. Is it worth $10? I'm not so sure I can justify that price, but if you're looking to buy one of the Sakura games, then it should definitely be Sakura Angels if you want to get your money's worth.

14064842.review:
Buying this VN I had my doubts. Sakura Spirit wasn't exactly a quality title, although the artwork was pretty. However, after reading through Angels, I have no regrets on purchasing it. Although, the writing isn't exactly top notch; it is far from terrible. I found myself smirking quite a bit all the way through. It doesn't try to pretend to be anything other than a cutesy story based around magical fights, making breakfast & awkward romance. The artwork is top notch as well! I found myself appreciating how well done it was moreso than gawking at all the anime jubblies in said artwork. This is seriously some 5 star art! The novel also isn't COMPLETELY kinetic like Sakura Spirit. There are a lot of choices to be made but it doesn't change much outside of some dialogue for a few sentences. It stays on a set path (for the most part). 

Basically, if you're buying this in hopes of getting an experience close to Planetarian or Cho Dengeki Stryker, you will be disappointed. This is just a 2 hour (maybe 3 if you read slow) cutesy little novel full of fan service. It's not a story that is going to blow you away, nor is it something you will think about much long after you read through it. This is just a nice read to kill an afternoon. Nothing more, nothing less. If you like Cute, Boobs & Breakfast then this is for you!

An interesting and comedic story interwoven with classic RPG elements, Sakura Angels breathes tremendous new life into the RPG genre. The first few minutes introduces the main protagonist as someone we can all relate to: an average student trying to live an ordinary life, though his world is turned upside down when the angels came to him. Prior play of Sakura Spirit isn't required since the controls are simple so even new players can play at a leisurely pace. With an emotional story and dazzling character designs, Sakura Angels will make you reach for that kleenex and finish all the tissues before you can see how much the plot has affected you. 

10/10

14021457.review:
[h1]This has to be the best game I've ever played[/h1], to say it in Dunkey's words: "It's a masterpiece, ladies and gentlemen, it's a f**king masterpiece".

I don't even know where to begin as this game clearly outshines the competition in every aspect.

First up we have the [i]graphics[/i]: They told me GTA 5 is a real looker, but seriously guys, it doesnt even come close to be comparable to this game. Just look at their faces, not a single corner guys, this is the example of perfect aliasing, GTA, Far Cry 4, they all can bow down to this amazing monument created to display the best graphics possible in a computer game at the moment. And that's not all: Even my crappy pc can run it smoothly without dropping any frames. This game is a technological masterpiece, Star Citizen is dead before it went out of Alpha.  [b]Graphics: 10/10[/b]

[i]Sound[/i]: Oh my gosh don't even get me started on the sound this soundtrack is one of the most catchy themes i have ever heard. Forget the Portal soundtrack because Sakura Angels is all you need.  Also a huge plus compared to benchmarks in the sound category like Portal is that it has more than one track and all of them are equally amazing i just have to give it a full 10 points. [b]Sound: 10/10[/b]

[i]Controls[/i]: God damn guys the controls in this game are awesome. You can use the mouse, you can use the spacebar and you can even let it play all alone, this game has it all, forget your 400apm in sc2 using a steering wheel with force feedback. This game will make you enjoy yourself even more and it doesnt even require 1 apm if you play it on automode. This game is easy to learn but hard to master since one of your hands is always occupied anyway, but with the built in support for Beginners and advanced Zweihander strategies this game is your first step at becoming a professional. [b]Controls: 10/10[/b]

[i]Multiplayer[/i]: Forget the war between Battlefield and Call of Duty! The real multiplayer game is here to stay! Playable with an unlimited amount of friends at home or through skype everyone can play together. Just wipe out your Joysticks and start playin. Auto-mode makes sure you dont have to fight about whoever gets to click and lets be honest, we are far too concentrated on our joysticks anyway. [b]Multiplayer 10/10[/b]

As you can see there is literally no point speaking against this game. Sakura Angels is the best game of all time, it's the game Duke Nukem Forever promised us to be. [b]Overall rating 40/40[/b] ladies and gentlemen thanks for your attention, this will be the last message going out from my side, because Sakura Angels completed my life and theres nothing left for me to wish for.

14019019.review:
If you have played Sakura Spirit, you enjoyed that game you will enjoy this. However let me be honest here, I saw it coming when I realized the similiar names and art styles. However the R17 CG and artwork here are good and I bought the game because of it. 

The game takes place as you causally going through your day as Kenta and the "usual" anime route, encounter appears. You are then saved by two girls who happen to be magical. You eventually found out they are your new classmates. They protect you after getting involved. You have a few options in this game and you will always have an ending. The game in itself makes you have the option of an end between the two girls, Hikari and Sayaka. Now there is also an ending where you can get both and that route well is balanced.

A few thoughts
Usually in some VNs there are characters there that you know you can't date and I found that with Yuzuhi. It's like you have that antagonist you like but couldn't have. That was another defining interest. It's like wanting to know the face behind Tali from ME. Or having that one antagonist you wish for that one bed scene you wish. Yes we've been there and if it appeals and attracts, people will buy it.

Nonetheless the game filled the time and made me like it. Enjoyable. The story seems short like before and needed a bit more. A route with Yuzuhi would be nice! Same with what they could have done with Sakura Spirit with Tsuyuri. 
Nonetheless the game cg firs a 5/5. 
The story 3.7/5. 
Option choice and dialogue, some amusement, some we saw coming. 3.6-4.0/5.
 Give it a shot if you like. I can give a recommend for the art and that's another thing that sold me. However I think there needs to be more to VNs than just that.
 If I start being more detailed and do this out of 10 well I'm thinking 6-7/10 might be it.

Basically if you want to get the game go ahead. Enjoy it. However if price not for you, you could wait. There's no rush. There wasn't any continuations like other games too for instance that came about. For instance, indie developers who make games don't include a dlc or include expansion after release which is sad because I do believe some games need it. Otherwise it's just a quick one that people can see then pass up on.
